meanings.sent1: The preener in the mirror admired their appearance.
meanings.sent2: The colorful bird was a beautiful preener.
meanings.sent3: The little preener strutted around, showing off their new haircut.
meanings.sent4: She was a preener, always making sure her outfit was just right.
meanings.sent5: The peacock, a famous preener, flaunted its vibrant feathers.

meanings.definition: To groom or clean oneself, especially in a proud or self-satisfied manner.
meanings.sent1: After the cat's nap, it woke up to preener itself.
meanings.sent2: The cat would preener meticulously after every meal.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to preener happily after rolling in the grass.
meanings.sent4: She would preener before going out, wanting to look her best.
meanings.sent5: The bird preener its feathers with care, readying for flight.
